title: Inventory checklist | Help Center
article: Below is a helpful checklist of items you should have in your home so guests have a great experience. Chances are that you already own many of these items, but it’s a good idea to double check this list for anything you may be missing. Keep in mind that if any items below could run out during a guests stay (such as toilet paper), it is a good idea to have backup available and easily accessible for your guests. As an Amazon Associate, Fairly earns from qualifying purchases. Bathroom1. Bath mat 2. Bath towels (2 per guest) 3. Garbage can and trash bags 4. Hand soap and hand soap refill 5. Hand towels 6. Tissues 7. Toilet paper 8. Towel Hooks 9. Plunger and bowl brush 10. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash dispensers 11. Shampoo and conditioner refill 12. Body wash refill 13. Shower curtainOptional1. Body lotion 2. Feminine products 3. Hairdryer 4. Makeup mirror 5. Makeup wipes or towelBedroom(s)1. Bed linens 2. Charging outlet 3. Extra blankets and pillows 4. Garbage can 5. Hangers 6. Pillows and pillowcases 7. Mattress protectors 8. Shelving or dresserOptional1. Alarm clock 2. Bedside table lamp 3. Bedside table 4. Mirror 5. Safe/LockboxKitchen1. Chef knives 2. Coffee mugs 3. Cutlery 4. Cups 5. Dishes 6. Dish towels 7. Dishwashing soap and refill 8. Dishwasher detergent 9. Drying rack 10. Garbage can and trash bags 11. Hand soap and hand soap refill 12. Pots and pans 13. Ice trays 14. Kettle/water heater 15. Oven mitts 16. Paper towels 17. Plates 18. Salt and pepper 19. Cooking oil 20. Sponge or dish brush 21. Tupperware 22. Wine glasses 23. Bottle openerOptional1. Tea and coffee 2. Coffee maker 3. Coffee filters 4. Sugar packets 5. Food processor or blender 6. Basic non-perishable cooking ingredients 7. Spices 8. Aluminum foil 9. Plastic wrap 10. Sandwich storage bags 11. Gallon storage bagsLiving Room1. Welcome bookletOptional1. Books or magazines 2. Coasters 3. Pen and paper 4. Cards and board games 5. MoviesAppliances1. Refrigerator and freezer 2. Stovetop 3. TV 4. Washer and dryer with detergent 5. WiFi router 6. Thermostat 7. Microwave 8. Toaster ovenOptional1. Smart TV 2. Iron or steamer 3. Cable or streaming service 4. Pellets or firewoodIf any appliances in your house are not common or are tricky to use, consider putting instructions of how to use them in a welcome book or sign placed near the appliance (for example, instructions on how to use a pellet stove). Safety Supplies1. Carbon monoxide alarm 2. Fire extinguisher 3. First aid kit 4. Smoke alarm 5. Evacuation route (if applicable)Optional1. Thermometer 2. Flashlight 3. Emergency contact listKid and Pet Friendly Items (Optional)1. High chair 2. Travel crib 3. Bowls for pet food and water 4. Towels to wipe off pets 5. Dog poop bags 6. Pet stain and odor remover 7. Extra cleaning suppliesHot Tub Care (Optional)1. Pool chemical test strips 2. Hot tub maintenance system 3. Hot tub chlorine replacement cartridges 4. Defoamer 5. Hot tub filter cleaner 6. Water treatment 7. Natural enzyme treatment 8. Chlorinating concentrateLocally Relevant Items (Optional)1. Snow shovel 2. Sled 3. Beach toys 4. Beach, pool, or hot tub towels 5. Umbrella 6. Local maps/brochures
claude_summary: Comprehensive checklist of essential and optional items hosts should provide in their rental properties to ensure guests have a comfortable, well-equipped stay.
